intro: Khadia carolinensis, commonly known as the Carolina rocket, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, small, yellow flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has slender, branching stems and pinnately compound leaves with small, ovate leaflets. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and along roadsides. The seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas.
